data.title: Journey to Horseshoe Bend, op. 64 : Symphonic cantata for solo voices, narrators, choirs and orchestra by Andrew Schultz and Gordon Kalton Williams : Work : Australian Music Centre
data.meta_description: Journey to Horseshoe Bend, op. 64 : Symphonic cantata for solo voices, narrators, choirs and orchestra by Andrew Schultz and Gordon Kalton Williams - find sheet music, recordings, digital score and audio samples, analysis, performances and more at the Australian Music Centre.
data.text:
Work Details

Year: 2003

Instrumentation: Boy soprano, bass baritone, 2 narrators/actors, SA choir, SATB choir, 2 flutes (2nd doubling piccolo), 2 oboes (2nd doubling cor anglais), 2 clarinets in B flat, bass clarinet in B flat, 2 bassoons (2nd doubling contra-bassoon), 4 horns in F, 3 trumpets in C, 2 tenor trombones, bass trombone, tuba, timpani, percussion (5 players), harp, electronic organ, strings.

Duration: 55 min.

Difficulty: Advanced

Contents note: 1. Hermannsburg -- 2. Idracowra -- 3. Horseshoe Bend.

Commission note: Commissioned by Symphony Australia for performance by Sydney Symphony with funds provided by Australia Council.

First performance: by David Porcelijn, Rodney Macann, David Bruce, John Stanton, Aaron Pedersen, Sydney Symphony, Sydney Philharmonia Motet Choir, Ntaria Ladies Choir, John Wregg — 28 May 03. Concert Hall, Sydney Opera House.

Orchestra is divided into four groups.
